DOC.brief_title: Effectiveness Coping Training People With HIV Experiencing Treatment Side Effects ( The Balance Project )
DOC.detailed_description: HIV virus transmit exchange bodily fluid , primarily sexual intercourse . HIV infection lead acquire immunodeficiency syndrome ( AIDS ) , disease break immune system allow entry life-threatening secondary infection . Antiretroviral therapy ( ART ) proven effectively inhibit replication HIV result reduction HIV-related death . People infect HIV receive ART , however , may confront negative physical emotional side effect . These side effect impact quality life ( QOL ) , adherence medical care , decision health care . Stress Coping Theory ( SCT ) person-centered approach considers stressful experience person-environment transaction . A cognitive behavioral treatment base upon SCT may help eliminate reduce negative impact side effect , improve QOL , maximize benefit treatment among people live HIV . This study evaluate effectiveness cognitive behavioral cop train improve side effect management treatment adherence HIV-infected people take ART medication . This study involve two phase . Phase 1 conducted 12 month include two 1-hour interview question personal life , family , friend , medication , medication side effect . After first interview , participant may invite participate Phase 2 , last 18 month . During Phase 2 , participant complete five 2- 3-hour interview occur baseline Months 3 , 6 , 12 , 18 . Interviews include question personal life , friend , family , health-related activity , drug-using behavior , emotion , mental state , educational background . Participants assign randomly one two treatment group : - Group 1 participant receive five individual session cognitive behavioral cop training , begin Month 3 interview . The 90-minute session focus cop stress , deal medication side effect , stay track medication . - Group 2 participant receive standard care one group session cop training , hold Month 18 interview . The group session cover material cover individual session . After last follow-up interview , participant may also ask complete exit interview thought feeling study participation .
